column4: so what else is illegal to do under linux in the us??  ...DVDs & w32codecs??  is this it?
actually, it's not illegal to watch DVDs under linux, the problem is nobody has bothered to put out a licensed DVD decoder, as of yet
so i can watch DVDs legally, it's just not "supported" by anybody?

the problem is that the DVD encoding standard is closed source, proprietary, and patented/copyrighted...anyone wanting to make a DVD player/decoder needs to pay a licensing fee....about $10,000...a minor matter for the major software manufacturers...but for an operating system you get for free, who's going to pay the fee?
